result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A Watts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bail applied to costs.  Remainder of costs to be paid by August 1, 2016 or penalty of 1 day Huber for non-payment consecutive to any other sentence.

First 60 days to be served straight time (without work release) to commence FORTHWITH.  Defendant may be released to Huber with Standard release conditions after the 60 days.  Sentence credit for 1 day was granted.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant Mark A Watts in court with attorney Erik I. Colque.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Colque makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Defendant's niece makes statements.    
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  

Sentence of:
1 year Jail. (Credit - 1 days).  Commences immediately.  First 60 days to be without work release.  Defendant may be released to Huber with Standard release conditions after the 60 days.  

COSTS:  $268.00  Bail to be applied
DNA Surcharge: $250.00
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid by August 1, 2016. Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 1 day in Huber consecutive
Sentencing hearing on April 27, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Mark A Watts in court with attorney Erik I. Colque.  Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Court schedules sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
